Package org.eleusoft.jsonread

JsonRead is a simple API to parse a JSON character stream building an object model.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    JsonArray
    A JSON Array value.
    JsonBoolean
    A JSON Boolean value.
    JsonNull
    A JSON null value.
    JsonNumber
    A JSON Numeric value.
    JsonObject
    A JSON Object value.
    JsonReadProvider
    Entry point, creates a JsonObject from a character stream.
    JsonString
    A JSON String value
    JsonType
    An enumeration of JSON types.
    JsonValue
    A JSON Value, base interface for all values.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    JsonException
    A runtime exception that can be used to signal a problem with the API usage.
    JsonParsingException
    Exception used by JsonReadProvider to signal a syntax error in a JSON character stream.

Package org.eleusoft.jsonread Description

JsonRead is a simple API to parse a JSON character stream building an object model.

The JsonRead API is very similar to a small, read-only subset of the javax.json API.

The JsonRead API is meant for a client that must parse a JSON document and be able to access the JSON Values it contains.

The JsonRead API is not meant as a way to easily access from the Java Language values serialized in a JSON document (Eg: no specialized accessors like getBoolean()) but more as a way to explore the JSON document structure.

A purpose of the JsonRead API is to represent a JSON Document with an Object Model that can represent the concepts present in the JSON Specification, see also http://www.json.org/

Ideally the Object Model should be able to represent what was in the source JSON, this aspect is mainly relevant with JSON Numbers: ideally a JSON Number will maintain also the representation present in the source and not only the Number binding.

Ideally an implementation of this API should not degrade a wrong value to a JSON String but throw a parsing exception, examples of wrong values are: NaN, .0, +0, 034, Infinity.

An other purpose of the JsonRead API is to be able to compare results and performance of different JSON Parser implementations using a common API, there are implementations of this package for the following JSON Parsers:

  • doubledutch LazyJSON

  • Jackson

  • Any parser that implements the javax.json API of JSR 353

  • JSON in Java [package org.json]

  • Json-lib (net.sf.json)

  • Gson

  • Argo

  • Jsonij

  • Mjson

  • Fastjson

  • JSONUtil

  • JJSON

  • Cookjson

  • Genson

  • Json-Smart V.2

  • Apache Johnzon

  • Minimal-json

The functionalities/requirements of the JsonRead API are:

  1. JsonReadProviderLoader is used to obtain the default JsonReadProvider registered. Which library is loaded depends on the jsonread and json-parsers implementations present in the class-path, a client application can always define its own META-INF/services/org.eleusoft.jsonread.JsonReadProvider file containing the name of the implementation to use.

  2. JsonReadProvider creates a JsonObject from a character stream throwing JsonParsingException if source has syntax errors and JsonException for any other problem like an IOException.

  3. A JsonObject offers access by key to values of the (unordered) mappings it contains in the form of JsonValue, it exposes also the set of keys.

  4. A JsonValue can be a:

    1. JsonObject
    2. JsonArray
    3. JsonNumber
    4. JsonString
    5. JsonBoolean
    6. JsonNull

    implementation instances can be discriminated using instanceof operator or using JsonValue.getType(), they are not required to implement equals(Object) or hashCode().

  5. A JsonObject exposes the (unordered) keys of the mappings it contains.

  6. A JsonNumber offers access to the JSON Number it represents as a String and as a Number, ideally the String representation should be the source value.

  7. A JsonArray exposes its size and offers access to the JsonValue instances it contains by position.

  8. A JsonString simply contains its textual value.

  9. Singleton instances of true, false and null can be retrieved from JsonBoolean and JsonNull.

  10. There are no requirements on the runtime exceptions thrown by the methods of JsonObject and JsonArray (typically an not existing name or an index out of bounds), they might throw JsonException or an implementation specific runtime exception like ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

  11. An implementation of JsonReadProvider must fail fast (in static initializer) when the libraries it depends on are not available.
